docs.snippet: Hundreds of fans and news media members flocked to a strip mall in suburban Hoover, Ala., last week for the 30th edition of SEC media days....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of fans and news media members flocked to a strip mall in suburban Hoover, Ala., last week for the 30th edition of SEC media days.
docs.abstract: Marc Tracy On College Football column notes that college Southeastern Conference media day, held this year in Hoover, Ala, has become a packed free-for-all for die-hard fans; notes that hundreds of University Alabama fans showed up for event, despite fact that season does not begin for six weeks.

headline.seo: SEC Media Days a Magnet for College Football Fans and News Media
headline.main: Midsummer Event, Midseason Form for SEC Fans
headline.print_headline: Midsummer Event, Midseason Form for SEC Fans

docs.snippet: For 16 years, Spanier oversaw the school’s growth from remote outpost of American higher education to top-tier public university. Now he is facing felony charges. How much should anyone pay for a sin of omission?...
docs.lead_paragraph: For 16 years, Spanier oversaw the school’s growth from remote outpost of American higher education to top-tier public university. Now he is facing felony charges. How much should anyone pay for a sin of omission?
docs.abstract: Former Pennsylvania State University president Graham B Spanier still awaits a trial, more than 20 months after the state charged him with eight criminal counts related to child sex abuse scandal of Penn State assistant football coach Jerry Sandusky; case against Spanier is at best problematic, at worst fatally flawed.

headline.main: The Trials of Graham Spanier, Penn State’s Ousted President

docs.snippet: A Toronto investment group led by rock star Jon Bon Jovi would not plan to move the Buffalo Bills out of western New York if it buys the team, according to the Toronto Sun....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Toronto investment group led by rock star Jon Bon Jovi would not plan to move the Buffalo Bills out of western New York if it buys the team, according to the Toronto Sun.

docs.snippet: A century of samba football, which began when an English team turned up unexpectedly in Rio de Janeiro in 1914 and took on a cobbled-together 'Brazil' side, was remembered in a celebratory match at the same stadium on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A century of samba football, which began when an English team turned up unexpectedly in Rio de Janeiro in 1914 and took on a cobbled-together 'Brazil' side, was remembered in a celebratory match at the same stadium on Sunday.

headline.main: Exeter in Samba Celebration of Unlikely First Brazil Game
headline.print_headline: Exeter in Samba Celebration of Unlikely First Brazil Game

docs.snippet: Mr. Steeg was a maker of educational and industrial films. His best-known works have been seen by millions of prospective jurors in New York State....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Steeg was a maker of educational and industrial films. His best-known works have been seen by millions of prospective jurors in New York State.
docs.abstract: Ted Steeg, a documentarian who produced the informational movies long shown to prospective jurors throughout New York State, dies at age 84.

headline.main: Ted Steeg, Who Found Big Audience With Jury Duty Films, Dies at 84
headline.print_headline: Ted Steeg, 84, Whose Jury Duty Films Had Captive Audience

docs.snippet: ELKUS--Christopher James, passed away peacefully at his home in Ligonier, PA on Wednesday, July 16th following a long and progressive illness. He was born in New York City on February 7, 1941 and was raised in Pittsburgh, PA, the son of James H. E...
docs.lead_paragraph: ELKUS--Christopher James, passed away peacefully at his home in Ligonier, PA on Wednesday, July 16th following a long and progressive illness. He was born in New York City on February 7, 1941 and was raised in Pittsburgh, PA, the son of James H. Elkus and Lenore R. Elkus. His mother was a founder of WQED-TV in Pittsburgh and a Distinguished Daughter of Pennsylvania. His father was an industrial engineer. His paternal grandfather, the Hon. Abram I. Elkus, served as US Ambassador to Turkey under President Wilson and as a judge on the New York State Court of Appeals. His maternal grandmother, Hulda Lashanska, was a celebrated American concert soprano. He is survived by his wife of 42 years, Gretchen M. Elkus of Ligonier, PA, his son James M. EIkus and grand-daughter Sonya R. Elkus of New York City and his sister Peggy H. Elkus of Pittsburgh. His brother Jonathan H. Elkus of Geneva, Switzerland died in 2003. He is also survived by his stepchildren William M. Duryea of Tampa, FL and his children William, Peter and Andrew Duryea and Melissa Duryea Lewis of San Anselmo, CA and her children Olivia and Augusta Lewis. Mr. Elkus was a graduate of St. Paul's School in Concord, NH, Yale University and New York University School of Business. He resided in New York City throughout most of his adult life where he worked as an investment manager for large corporations and organizations such as the United Nations. He was dedicated member of his community and served as President of the Lenox Hi Neighborhood House, a multi-service organization that has served people in need on the East Side of Manhattan and on Roosevelt Island for over 120 years. He later founded Waterford Capital Management upon his retirement to Ligonier, PA. He was an avid sportsman, traveler and lover of the outdoors. While at St. Paul's he excelled at football, rowing and wrestling. Following his competitive sports years he enjoyed skiing, fishing, hunting, golf, squash and tennis. He was a member of the Racquet & Tennis Club and the Brook Club in New York, the Piping Rock Club on Long Island and the Rolling Rock Club in Ligonier, Pennsylvania. His family extends their warmest thanks to his doctors and his dedicated caregivers Nan, Trudy, Tracy, Tammy M., Sue, Karen and Tammy T. A memorial service will be held at the Rolling Rock Club in Ligonier, PA on Saturday, September 6th at 11am. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to St. Paul's School with 'Elkus Family' in the memo section (Attn: Gifts Manager, 325 Pleasant Street, Concord, NH, 03301, 603-229-4713) or to the Lenox Hill Neighborhood House with 'Christopher Elkus' in the memo section (Attn: Development Department, 331 East 70th Street, New York, NY 10021). The J. Paul McCraken Funeral Chapel, Inc., Ligonier, PA is assisting the family, 144 E. Main St., Ligonier, PA 15658.

docs.snippet: The bride and groom met while playing poker in Atlantic City....
docs.lead_paragraph: The bride and groom met while playing poker in Atlantic City.
